skill.name: Hook Development
skill.description: This skill should be used when the user asks to "create a hook", "add a PreToolUse/PostToolUse/Stop hook", "validate tool use", "implement prompt-based hooks", "use ${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT}", "set up event-driven automation", "block dangerous commands", or mentions hook events (PreToolUse, PostToolUse, Stop, SubagentStop, SessionStart, SessionEnd, UserPromptSubmit, PreCompact, Notification). Provides comprehensive guidance for creating and implementing Claude Code plugin hooks with focus on advanced prompt-based hooks API.
skill.summary: This skill should be used when the user asks to "create a hook", "add a PreToolUse/PostToolUse/Stop ...
skill.author: anthropics

security_audit.summary: Official skill from an Anthropic source, so only a minimal audit was required. No security issues were identified in the scanned files.

content.value_statement: Hook setups often fail due to invalid schemas, weak checks, or missing tests. This skill provides templates, validators, and test helpers to build reliable Claude Code hooks.
actual_capabilities: Validate hooks.json structure and event names with validate-hook-schema.sh
Lint hook scripts for common safety checks and best practices with hook-linter.sh
Generate sample hook inputs for supported event types via test-hook.sh
Run hook scripts with timeouts and environment variables using test-hook.sh
Provide example scripts for PreToolUse validation and SessionStart context loading
limitations: Does not execute hooks inside Claude Code
Requires bash and jq for the provided scripts
No automatic deployment or registration of hooks
Hook changes require a Claude Code restart to take effect

use_cases.title: Validate a new hook
use_cases.description: Check hooks.json and script quality before publishing a Claude Code plugin.

use_cases.title: Block risky tool use
use_cases.description: Add PreToolUse checks to deny dangerous commands and unsafe writes.

use_cases.title: Standardize hook quality
use_cases.description: Enforce consistent validation and testing across multiple plugins.

prompt_templates.title: First PreToolUse hook
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a PreToolUse prompt hook that blocks writes to /etc and .env files. Provide hooks.json wrapper format for a plugin.

prompt_templates.title: Validate hooks.json
prompt_templates.prompt: Show the command to run validate-hook-schema.sh on hooks/hooks.json and explain what warnings mean.

prompt_templates.title: Test a hook script
prompt_templates.scenario: Run a hook with sample input
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate sample input for PreToolUse and show how to run scripts/test-hook.sh with verbose output.

prompt_templates.title: Layered Bash checks
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a PreToolUse setup for Bash with a fast command check and a prompt review. Use matchers and include timeouts.

output_examples.input: Check my hook scripts and configuration for common issues.
output: hooks.json parses correctly and uses valid event names
Hook script is missing set -euo pipefail
Found unquoted variables that may allow injection
Timeout values are within recommended ranges

best_practices: Validate JSON output and exit codes during tests
Keep hooks fast and set explicit timeouts
anti_patterns: Hardcoded absolute paths in hook commands
Prompt hooks on unsupported events without warnings

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude Code hooks?
faq.answer: Yes. It targets Claude Code hook events and formats described in the skill files.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance and scripts but does not deploy or run hooks inside Claude Code.

faq.question: How do I integrate it into my plugin?
faq.answer: Use the hooks.json plugin format and call the scripts from your plugin directory.

faq.question: Does it handle data safely?
faq.answer: Examples focus on validation and do not store data beyond temporary files.

faq.question: What if a validation script fails?
faq.answer: Check jq availability, file paths, and script permissions, then rerun with verbose output.

faq.question: How does this compare to basic hooks?
faq.answer: It adds prompt hook guidance plus validators, linters, and test helpers.
